intro: Hieracium abruptorum, commonly known as the abrupt hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and disturbed soils, often forming dense mats. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium abruptorum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
